scopes.https://uri.paypal.com/services/customer: Manage referral data shared by Partner with PayPal. To be used by only internal apps
Manage external referral data with PayPal

partner_id.description: The ID of the partner for which to show onboarded seller's credentials, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to **Profile**, click **Profile and settings**, and click **My business info**. The account number appears in the **Merchant account ID** section.

The ID of the partner for which to show onboarded seller's credentials, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to **Profile**, click **Profile and settings**, and click **My business info**. The account number appears in the **Merchant account ID** section.

tracking_id.description: Filters the sellers in the response by this partner-provided seller ID (`merchant_id`).

fields.description: Filters the fields in the response to this comma-separated list of fields.

merchant_id.description: The ID of the seller for which to show status information.

partner_id.description: The ID of the partner for which to show onboarded seller's credentials, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to **Profile**, click **Profile and settings**, and click **My business info**. The account number appears in the **Merchant account ID** section.

Content-type.description: The Content-type header MUST be described in all externally-accessible APIs.

X-PAYPAL-SECURITY-CONTEXT.description: The X-PAYPAL-SECURITY-CONTEXT header MUST be described in all externally-accessible APIs.

country_code.description: The country code to load region preferences.

id.description: The ID of the partner, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to **Profile**, click **Profile and settings**, and click **My business info**. The account number appears in the **Merchant account ID** section.

product.description: The product to load region and integration preferences.

partner_read.description: Show partner information - agreements and preferences

partner_referral_id.description: The ID of the partner-referrals data for which to show details.

limits.description: An array of limitations on the capability.

AccountIdentifier.description: The PayPal account ID of the partner.

type.description: The type of ID for the account.

AccountIdentifierInput.description: The PayPal account ID of the partner.

type.description: The type of ID for the account.

AccountOwnerRelationship.description: The familial relationship of the seller account owner.

country_code_of_nationality.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

AccountOwnerRelationshipInput.description: The familial relationship of the seller account owner.

country_code_of_nationality.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

Address.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

country_code.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

line1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street.

line2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

state.description: The [code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/) for a US state or the equivalent for other countries. Required for transactions if the address is in one of these countries: [Argentina](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#argentina), [Brazil](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#brazil), [Canada](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#canada), [China](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#china), [India](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#india), [Italy](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#italy), [Japan](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#japan), [Mexico](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#mexico), [Thailand](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#thailand), or [United States](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#usa). Maximum length is 40 single-byte characters.

AddressInput.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

country_code.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

line1.description: The first line of the address. For example, number or street.

line2.description: The second line of the address. For example, suite or apartment number.

postal_code.description: The postal code, which is the zip code or equivalent. Typically required for countries with a postal code or an equivalent. See [postal code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Postal_code).

state.description: The [code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/) for a US state or the equivalent for other countries. Required for transactions if the address is in one of these countries: [Argentina](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#argentina), [Brazil](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#brazil), [Canada](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#canada), [China](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#china), [India](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#india), [Italy](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#italy), [Japan](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#japan), [Mexico](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#mexico), [Thailand](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#thailand), or [United States](/docs/integration/direct/rest/state-codes/#usa). Maximum length is 40 single-byte characters.

BankDetails.description: The required information to add a card as a financial instrument to PayPal through onboarding.

account_number.description: The bank account number. These are numeric values only without any additional formatting.

account_type.description: The type of account, which is checking or savings.

branch_location.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

currency_code.description: The primary [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) for the account.

identifiers.description: An array of instrument institute attributes. Used with the account number to uniquely identify the instrument. Value is:For banks with IBAN information, the IBAN number.For banks with BBAN information, the BBAN number.For banks with both IBAN and BBAN information, the IBAN number.

mandate_agreed.description: Indicates whether the user has agreed to the mandate for financial instrument (FI) authorization.

nick_name.description: The user-provided short name for the user's bank account.

DateOfEvent.description: The date for an event type. Typically captured during onboarding.

event_date.description: The date portion of the date and time when the event occurred, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6). For accuracy, if you do not know the exact time zone, use the UTC time zone.

event_type.description: The event type for an onboarding entity.

event_type.description: The event type for an onboarding entity.

EmailContact.description: The email address. Includes the role of the email address.

email_address.description: The internationalized email address.Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

role.description: The role of the email address.

role.description: The role of the email address.

IdentityDocument.description: The authority-issued identification document. Document types include a driver's license, social security number, employee ID number, and so on.

issuer_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO-3166-1 country code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) for the country that issued the document.

partial_value.description: Indicates whether the value is a partial value. Specify this value when the identifier type supports a partial value, such as four SSN digits instead of the full nine values. Depending on the context, this parameter can be ignored.

type.description: The identifier type in the onboarding domain. Indicates the most specific type or the closest matching value. For example, SOCIAL_SECURITY_NUMBER in preference to TAX_IDENTIFICATION_NUMBER.

value.description: The identifier value, such as license number, social security number, and so on.

IntegrationDetails.description: The integration details for the partner and customer relationship. Required if `capability_type` is `API_INTEGRATION`.

partner_id.description: The payer ID of the partner who integrates with the client. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to Profile, click Profile and settings, and click My business info. The account number appears in the Merchant account ID section.

rest_api_integration.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

rest_first_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal First Party REST endpoints.

rest_third_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

rest_third_party_details.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

integration_type.description: The type of REST-endpoint integration. To integrate with Braintree v.zero for PayPal REST endpoints, specify `REST_THIRD_PARTY_DETAILS`.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner.

seller_nonce.description: S256 - The code verifier must be high-entropy cryptographic random string with a byte length of 43-128 range.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner's API caller account.

IntegrationDetailsRestThirdPartyDetailsI.description: The integration details for PayPal REST endpoints.

feature_list.description: An array of features that partner can access, or use, in PayPal on behalf of the seller. The seller grants permission for these features to the partner.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner's API caller account.

granted.description: Indicates whether the customer agreed to share this type of data. To give consent, specify `true`. To withhold consent, specify `false`.

type.description: The type of consent. `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` gives consent to you to share your customer's data with PayPal.

granted.description: Indicates whether the customer agreed to share this type of data. To give consent, specify `true`. To withhold consent, specify `false`.

type.description: The type of consent. `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` gives consent to you to share your customer's data with PayPal.

Limitation.description: The limitations on a seller account.

name.description: The title of the limitation that is applied to the account.

restrictions.description: An array of the restriction names.

href.description: The complete target URL. To make the related call, combine the method with this [URI Template-formatted](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6570) link. For pre-processing, include the `$`, `(`, and `)` characters. The `href` is the key HATEOAS component that links a completed call with a subsequent call.

method.description: The HTTP method required to make the related call.

rel.description: The [link relation type](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5988#section-4), which serves as an ID for a link that unambiguously describes the semantics of the link. See [Link Relations](https://www.iana.org/assignments/link-relations/link-relations.xhtml).

MerchantIntegration.description: The `merchant-integration` status information for a partner.

capabilities.description: An array of capabilities associated with the products integrated between seller and partner.

date_created.description: The date when the seller account was created, in [Internet date and time format](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

given_name.description: The given name of the seller. Only available for casual sellers.

granted_permissions.description: An array of permissions granted to the partner by the seller.

legal_name.description: The legal business name of the seller.

limitations.description: An array of limitations on the seller account.

merchant_id.description: The payer ID of the seller after creation of their PayPal account.

oauth_integrations.description: An array of information about OAuth integrations between partners and sellers.

payments_receivable.description: Indicates whether the seller account can receive payments.

primary_email.description: The primary email address of the seller.

primary_email_confirmed.description: Indicates whether the primary email of the seller has been confirmed.

products.description: An array of all products that are integrated with the partner for the seller.

surname.description: The surname of the seller. Only available for casual sellers.

tracking_id.description: The partner-provided tracking ID, if one was provided.

MerchantIntegrationCredentials.description: The `merchant-integration` merchant credentials for a downloadable cart seller.

client_id.description: The client ID of the seller.

client_secret.description: The client secret of the seller.

payer_id.description: The payer ID of the seller and the pattern is not provided because the value is defined by an external party.

language_code.description: The [locale code](/docs/api/reference/locale-codes/) for the language of the message, such as `en_US`.
The [locale code](/docs/api/reference/locale-codes/) for the language of the message, such as `en_US`.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

alternate_full_name.description: DEPRECATED. The party's alternate name. Can be a business name, nickname, or any other name that cannot be split into first, last name. Required when the party is a business.

full_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's full name.

given_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's given, or first, name.

middle_name.description: When the party is a person, the party's middle name. Use also to store multiple middle names including the patronymic, or father's, middle name.

prefix.description: The prefix, or title, to the party's name.

suffix.description: The suffix for the party's name.

surname.description: When the party is a person, the party's surname or family name. Also known as the last name. Required when the party is a person. Use also to store multiple surnames including the matronymic, or mother's, surname.

OauthIntegration.description: The status of the oauth-integration between a partner and seller.

integration_method.description: The integration method that the partner uses to integrate with PayPal APIs.

integration_type.description: The type of integration between the partner and the seller.

oauth_third_party.description: An array of combinations of `partner_client_id` and `merchant_client_id` values and their associated scopes.

OauthThirdParty.description: The seller third-party information for REST API.

access_token.description: The access token for the partner-selected integration method.

merchant_client_id.description: The client ID of the seller.

partner_client_id.description: The client ID of the partner's API caller account.

refresh_token.description: The refresh token for the partner-selected integration method.

scopes.description: An array of scopes that the seller granted the partner.

OfficeBearer.description: The office bearers of the account.

home_address.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

nationality_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

phone_contacts.description: An array of contact phone numbers for the customer.

role.description: Role of the person party played in the business.

OfficeBearerInput.description: The office bearers of the account.

nationality_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

phone_contacts.description: An array of contact phone numbers for the customer.

role.description: Role of the person party played in the business.

Partner.description: The seller acquisition partner-related information. Defines the settings for the customized onboarding experience of the seller.

display_name.description: The display name of the partner.

integration_preferences.description: An array of required information for a partner to integrate this product. Varies based on the product to integrate.

launch_type.description: Indicates whether the onboarding occurs in a full browser, mini-browser, or light box.

logo_url.description: The partner logo URL. Provides a way for partners to update their logo through preferences. This logo over-writes any image URL provided earlier for their business accounts.

partner_id.description: The account ID of the partner.

product_selection.description: Indicates whether the seller can select a product with which to integrate.

receives_credential.description: Indicates whether the partner is integrated to receive a seller credential.

partner_id.description: The account ID of the partner.

product_selection.description: Indicates whether the seller can select a product with which to integrate.

receives_credential.description: Indicates whether the partner is integrated to receive a seller credential.

PartnerSpecificIdentifiers.description: The identifier for the customer in the partner's system.

PartnerSpecificIdentifiersInput.description: The identifier for the customer in the partner's system.

account_owner_relationships.description: An array of familial relationships that are attached to a seller.

email_address.description: The internationalized email address.Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

home_address.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

identity_documents.description: An array of documents that uniquely identify the user, such as a license number, social security number, and so on.

nationality_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

phone_contacts.description: An array of contact phone numbers for the customer.

account_owner_relationships.description: An array of familial relationships that are attached to a seller.

email_address.description: The internationalized email address.Note: Up to 64 characters are allowed before and 255 characters are allowed after the @ sign. However, the generally accepted maximum length for an email address is 254 characters. The pattern verifies that an unquoted @ sign exists.

home_address.description: A simple postal address with coarse-grained fields. Do not use for an international address. Use for backward compatibility only. Does not contain phone.

identity_documents.description: An array of documents that uniquely identify the user, such as a license number, social security number, and so on.

nationality_country_code.description: The [two-character ISO 3166-1 code](/docs/integration/direct/rest/country-codes/) that identifies the country or region.Note: The country code for Great Britain is GB and not UK as used in the top-level domain names for that country. Use the `C2` country code for China worldwide for comparable uncontrolled price (CUP) method, bank card, and cross-border transactions.

phone_contacts.description: An array of contact phone numbers for the customer.

Phone.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

PhoneDetails.description: The phone number and the phone type.

phone_number_details.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

PhoneDetailsInput.description: The phone number and the phone type.

phone_number_details.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

PhoneInput.description: The phone number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en).

country_code.description: The country calling code (CC), in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the CC and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

national_number.description: The national number, in its canonical international [E.164 numbering plan format](https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/en). The combined length of the country calling code (CC) and the national number must not be greater than 15 digits. The national number consists of a national destination code (NDC) and subscriber number (SN).

capabilities.description: An array of the capability names bundled in the parent product.

status.description: The status of product bundle, if applicable.

vetting_status.description: The risk vetting status of product, if applicable.

ProductIntegration.description: The required information for a partner to integrate this product.

credential_type.description: The credential type for a first-party integration. Required if `integration_type` is provided.

integration_type.description: The integration type for the product as third or first party or sellers that are onboarded through this partner.

permissions.description: An array of permissions that the partner expects that the seller has granted for a third-party integration. Different products need different permissions, so permissions also depend on the product.

ProductIntegrationInput.description: The required information for a partner to integrate this product.

credential_type.description: The credential type for a first-party integration. Required if `integration_type` is provided.

integration_type.description: The integration type for the product as third or first party or sellers that are onboarded through this partner.

permissions.description: An array of permissions that the partner expects that the seller has granted for a third-party integration. Different products need different permissions, so permissions also depend on the product.

ProductPreferences.description: The product preferences. A partner can customize these preferences based on the country and product.

product.description: The product to which these preferences belong.

url.description: The URL to which to redirect the seller after sign-up is complete.

ProductPreferencesInput.description: The product preferences. A partner can customize these preferences based on the country and product.

product.description: The product to which these preferences belong.

url.description: The URL to which to redirect the seller after sign-up is complete.

ReferralData.description: The referral data that partners share with PayPal.

collected_consents.description: An array of all consents that the partner has received from this seller. If `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` is not granted, PayPal does not store customer data.

customer_data.description: The customer's business and personal data that is required to create an account.

products.description: An array of PayPal products to which the partner wants to onboard the customer.

requested_capabilities.description: An array of capabilities to enable for the customer while he or she shares the data.

web_experience_preference.description: The preference to customize the web experience of the customer.

ReferralDataInput.description: The referral data that partners share with PayPal.

collected_consents.description: An array of all consents that the partner has received from this seller. If `SHARE_DATA_CONSENT` is not granted, PayPal does not store customer data.

customer_data.description: The customer's business and personal data that is required to create an account.

products.description: An array of PayPal products to which the partner wants to onboard the customer.

requested_capabilities.description: An array of capabilities to enable for the customer while he or she shares the data.

web_experience_preference.description: The preference to customize the web experience of the customer.

partner_referral_id.description: The ID to access the customer's data shared by the partner with PayPal.

referral_data.description: The referral data that partners share with PayPal.

submitter_payer_id.description: The payer ID of the partner who shared the referral data.

country_code.description: The [two-character ISO-3166-1 country code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) for the country that is associated with the preferences.

product_preferences.description: An array of product preferences. Can change for a country or product.

return_message.description: An array of messages to the seller from the partner after completion of sign-up. The message can change by country and language.

country_code.description: The [two-character ISO-3166-1 country code](/docs/api/reference/country-codes/) for the country that is associated with the preferences.

product_preferences.description: An array of product preferences. Can change for a country or product.

return_message.description: An array of messages to the seller from the partner after completion of sign-up. The message can change by country and language.

Signature.description: The signature portion of the seller credentials.

api_password.description: The API password of the seller.

api_user_name.description: The API user name of the seller.

signature.description: The signature credential of the seller.

User.description: The customer's business and personal data that is required to create an account.

customer_type.description: The type of PayPal account to create, which is consumer or seller.

financial_instrument_data.description: The customer's financial instrument. Use it to add a financial instrument to the customer's PayPal account.

partner_specific_identifiers.description: An array of customer identifiers in the partner's system.

preferred_language_code.description: The locale code of the user's preferred language.

primary_currency_code.description: The primary [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) of the account.

referral_user_payer_id.description: The PayPal account ID of the partner.

UserFinancialInstrumentData.description: The customer's financial instrument. Use it to add a financial instrument to the customer's PayPal account.

bank_details.description: An array of bank account details for the `ADD_BANK` capability.

UserFinancialInstrumentDataInput.description: The customer's financial instrument. Use it to add a financial instrument to the customer's PayPal account.

bank_details.description: An array of bank account details for the `ADD_BANK` capability.

UserInput.description: The customer's business and personal data that is required to create an account.

customer_type.description: The type of PayPal account to create, which is consumer or seller.

financial_instrument_data.description: The customer's financial instrument. Use it to add a financial instrument to the customer's PayPal account.

partner_specific_identifiers.description: An array of customer identifiers in the partner's system.

preferred_language_code.description: The locale code of the user's preferred language.

primary_currency_code.description: The primary [three-character ISO-4217 currency code](/docs/api/reference/currency-codes/) of the account.

referral_user_payer_id.description: The PayPal account ID of the partner.

WebExperiencePreference.description: The preference to customize the web experience of the customer.

action_renewal_url.description: If `renew_action_url` expires, redirect the customer to this URL.

partner_logo_url.description: The partner logo URL to display in the seller onboarding flow.Note: While there is no restriction on the size of your image, PayPal forces the max width to 106px and max height to 29px. The best resolution you can provide is 106px x 29px.

return_url.description: The URL to which to redirect the customer upon completion of the onboarding process.

return_url_description.description: The description of the return URL.

show_add_credit_card.description: Indicates whether to show an add credit card page.

show_mobile_confirm.description: Indicates whether to ask the customer to initiate confirmation of their mobile phone (the phone that the partner designated as `MOBILE` in the customer data). Default is`false`.

use_hua_email_confirmation.description: Indicates whether to use the `hosted_user_agreement_url` to confirm the customer's email address. If `true`, PayPal appends the email confirmation code to `hosted_user_agreement_url`, and when a customer successfully accesses the hosted user agreement URL, confirms the customer's email address. If `false`, PayPal does not append the confirmation code to the URL and does not confirm the email address.

use_mini_browser.description: Indicates whether to provide a single page signup flow in a mini browser. Default is to provide a full-size, multi-page flow.

WebExperiencePreferenceInput.description: The preference to customize the web experience of the customer.

action_renewal_url.description: If `renew_action_url` expires, redirect the customer to this URL.

partner_logo_url.description: The partner logo URL to display in the seller onboarding flow.Note: While there is no restriction on the size of your image, PayPal forces the max width to 106px and max height to 29px. The best resolution you can provide is 106px x 29px.

return_url.description: The URL to which to redirect the customer upon completion of the onboarding process.

return_url_description.description: The description of the return URL.

show_add_credit_card.description: Indicates whether to show an add credit card page.

show_mobile_confirm.description: Indicates whether to ask the customer to initiate confirmation of their mobile phone (the phone that the partner designated as `MOBILE` in the customer data). Default is`false`.

use_hua_email_confirmation.description: Indicates whether to use the `hosted_user_agreement_url` to confirm the customer's email address. If `true`, PayPal appends the email confirmation code to `hosted_user_agreement_url`, and when a customer successfully accesses the hosted user agreement URL, confirms the customer's email address. If `false`, PayPal does not append the confirmation code to the URL and does not confirm the email address.

use_mini_browser.description: Indicates whether to provide a single page signup flow in a mini browser. Default is to provide a full-size, multi-page flow.

Content-type.description: The Content-type header MUST be described in all externally-accessible APIs.

X-PAYPAL-SECURITY-CONTEXT.description: The X-PAYPAL-SECURITY-CONTEXT header MUST be described in all externally-accessible APIs.

body.description: The seller acquisition partner-related information. Defines the settings for the customized onboarding experience of the seller.

id.description: The ID of the partner, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account. Navigate to **Profile**, click **Profile and settings**, and click **My business info**. The account number appears in the **Merchant account ID** section.

id.description: The ID of the partner, which is the partner's PayPal account number. To find this ID, log in to the partner's PayPal business account.
